text: Excellent resort. Stayed with my 3 kids in a 3-bed apartment. The apartment was great, and we enjoyed the outdoor pool and indoor pool. The on-site restaurant, Levante, is great for breakfast and have really good options for lunch and dinner. For our first holiday abroad since the beginning of the pandemic, we couldn't have wished for a better stay.

Highly recommend this hotel, just maybe address the slamming of doors closing every night.Apart from that amazing hotel and staff are so helpful.The bed was pretty hard too and every morning i woke up with a sore back, but maybe just me getting older.........

Just spent a wonderful 7 nights here for a family Easter break.Jan was very helpful, immediately changed my apartment for me to a lower floor so it was easier with the kiddies.Lovely bottle of wine to welcome us, and the apartment was spotless, with maid service every day.Pool area very clean too!Also, had a lovely sea view!Would really recommend here!

We had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at Belmar at the end of July.  We were pleased with the resort the moment we arrived.  The checkin was quick and the front desk very professional.  The lobby is beautiful with a zen feel - water walls, quiet places to sit, reflection pool.  We had a 2 bedroom apartment in the main building and to our surprised we had a magnificent unobstructed ocean view (room D1G).  The apartment was well equipped and modern.  The beds were very comfortable.  Plenty of space for our family.  The beach is right across the street and it's great beach for families.  Fine sand and clean water.  We loved Porto de Mos beach!  There are two  restaurants at the beach plus a cafe/ice cream spot.  The indoor pool was a hit with the kids as the outdoor pools are not heated and rather cold. We did rent a car for 3 days because town was a good 40 min walk - 2 kms away. The front desk did it all for us.   We did tour Sagres and Cabo San Vicent as well as Pont da Piedade and surrounding areas.  We enjoyed going into Lagos centre for dinners and shopping.  .  We would  recommend this hotel and location.  Loved Belmar, loved Lagos and hope to return.

Had a really good week here in late October. The location is superb, less than 100m from a great beach with two nice restaurants. Short drive to the centre of Lagos. The hotel itself is good, average 4 star. The 2 bed apartment was fine, good kitchen, two balconies, washing machine and dishwasher.Beds are like slabs of concrete like most places, this alone means I won't return. Shower is not great, no overhead just hand held in a holder.Staff are very friendly and helpful. Good spa and indoor pool which is good for Oct. Bar is not appealing and we never ate in hotel with two good restaurants on the beach just down the road.Apartment was only cleaned twice in the week.All in all enjoyed the visit though purely based on location, not on facilities.  I need a good bed and shower and this had neither.

Everything was perfect during our stay. We celebrated my sister‚Äôs birthday and everyone at the reception, service and restaurant were very friendly and punctual, making the surprise very successful. I would only suggest adding a blackout curtain option in the sleeping room.
The Jupiter hotel is by far the best hotel we have stayed it . Everything about it was amazing . Will definitely be going back

DISGUSTING- avoid this place1.  DIRTY2.  OLD3.  BEDS ARE A JOKE- like cinder blocks4. RUDE staff5.  fitly dirty condos6. half the resort not in serviceSheets were filthy dirty- towels are like paper towels and dirty- floors were dirty - couch was disgusting

My husband and I stayed here right before Christmas and since it was our very first stay in a hostel, I was a bit apprehensive. We're mature travelers so I wasn't sure if we'd fit in or not. My fears were totally unfounded as we were made to feel welcome as soon as we arrived. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and answered all our questions cheerfully. They made our stay extra special. There were other over 40 folks staying as well and we enjoyed relaxing and chatting with fellow travelers in the lounge area in the evenings.Besides the terrific staff, other positives for me were the security measures in place, the common areas, the bar, and the refreshments cooler. Once we were in for the night, it was nice to be able to get a beer without having to go out again. Our room was basic with a comfy bed, desk, night stand, wardrobe, and chair. No TV but it did have a mini-fridge which I didn't expect. Also, the staff left some wine, water, and cookies in our room which was a very nice touch. We had a bathroom in our room which consisted of a toilet, sink, and a very small shower. I couldn't turn around in the shower so that may be a problem for a larger person. That's a small thing in an otherwise very great stay!

if you don't mind to share the room with other people this is the right place,even you can do your own thing,great location,really nice clean,awesome staff very helpful,,plus the prices are very good ,showers and toilettes clean .Was a good experience ,a place to go back for sure. Very beautiful decoration

There aren¬¥t bad things to say about this hostel. The owners has created a good atmosphore in this hostel, it¬¥s at the same time lively and calm; you can easily make friends and go out in the surrondings and also rest at night in one room of the several flats that this house has. The decoration is also well-designed. Breakfast is ok and the views form the terrace very nice. I recommend to have some coffe or drink at the terrace and chill out with some friends.Stay in this hotel and you¬¥ll enjoy oporto.

Just come back from a week at FdV. Stayed on sc basis although used restaurant which was fine.2 bed apartment was large and had everything you needed. Staff were friendly, helpful and gave a good impression. Reception staff in particular very good. No stag or hen parties, with hotel quite quiet overall.Location was great with easy walk to both old town and beach. Will certainly be back, on sc basis. May consider all inclusive but it's really full board.

When we got to Lisbon happy hostel we thought we got the wrong addressThere is no sign or anything showing that there was an hotel or hostel in the buildingThe restaurant next to it had a huge table and therefore we couldn't get in the building easilyThe room was pretty and basic so was the toilet but overall very nice.Kitchen was good, free food and clean spaceWifi was not working properly especially because we were located at the end of the corridor.The girls Woking there were nice but their English was not that goodI would love to revamp that hostel. It needs help to get attention out there

My husband and I recently added on three days to our visit to Portugal and chose the 1908 Lisboa Hotel.  Located within a convenient walk to get anywhere, the hotel is beautifully refurbished and updated.  The building shape is noticeably unique with a triangular shape.  We spotted it right away.  As soon as we walked in, the service was outstanding.  Andrew took care of our car, arranged our luggage, showed us around the room pointing out all the features to make ourselves comfortable, namely the air conditioning and free phone to use with internet as we explore the city.  We were welcomed with a private ‚Äúget to know the city‚Äù talk from Joann.  She spent at least 30 minutes showing us the map and helping us to plan or next 2 days.  She set us up with the bus tours, restaurant suggestions, and a wonderful private tour to Sintra.  We would not have been able to enjoy the city so efficiently without her guidance!  thank you to both Andrew and Joann!Awesome experienceWould love to come back!K and R RasconArizona visitors to PortugalPS the beds were super comfortable andThe breakfast we enjoyed each morning was superb!

After staying in about 20+ hostels, this is one of the best I have ever stayed at. The staff is extremely welcoming and enthusiastic about Lisbon. I traveled there by myself and was able to meet so many great travelers from all over the world that were around my same age. Any question you had, the staff was able to help you and everything was kept very clean. I highly recommend eating the hostel's food. The chef is very good for a great price! Additionally, it is a very safe hostel with individual boxes in each room to lock up and 24 hour front desk attendants. I would highly recommend this hostel to my other friends traveling to Lisbon.

This is probably the best located hostel we have ever stayed in. We are quite a bit older than the usual hostel crowd but fit right in - the Portugese buffet was wonderful, breakfasts lovely and lots of opportunity to meet other travelers. Our double room with a private bath was clean and quiet.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: A hotel with excellent location and excellent service. We enjoyed every minute of our holiday. A breakfast with everything you can wish for and free transportation within the area. Also enjoyed a round of golf at our favourite course San Lorenzo!

We stayed Forte Do Vale and had a superb holiday in May 2017.  We had a one bedroom apartment that was superbly serviced by Svetlana every day except Sundays.  While the room did not overlook the pool, we were lucky enough to have a west facing room with a nice balcony where we could wind down with a glass of Spumante from a hectic day of winding down, watching the sunset enabled us to re-charge our batteries for the evening ahead.  Spumante has re-invented itself and we found it tastier than Prosecco.The hotel is very spacious and the staff are superb.  We didn't eat in the restaurant although the menu and food looked good and we tended not to use the bar except for an aperitif.  We did use the pool area every day.The great thing about the hotel is that it is split evenly between 'The Strip' (if that's your thing and the the beach area.  A slightly further walk is the Old Town which is serviced by a road-train that happens to stop at the hotel.  Good atmosphere.  There are too many good restaurants to mention.We hired a car at approx 7.50Euros per day through Gold car and they were excellent - the car was booked a month before travelling and it enabled us to travel to many good beaches and towns.  We also bought insurance in the UK as it was cheaper.There are a bout 5 MGM hotels in Albufiera and we thought ours was the best - the others were under construction. so didn't have a pool etc.We will probably return to Forte Do Vale.

The hotel was extremely comfortable and the staff really friendly. The breakfast was amazing with a huge choice. The buffet dinner was excellent. I can't believe some of the moans of previous reviews.The room was fantastic with a beautiful view bath and an enormous bed. The cost of the room was extremely good value.I really recommend this hotel. Lots of good restaurants nearby and metro 7 minute walk.

Stayed last week and weekend for 6 nights, upgraded to exec lounge which was great. Room spacious and clean and lounge very high quality and good offering. The pool area was clean, well maintained and really nice sunbeds. The lobby bar was our best part, we were really looked after with advice on cocktails, tourist sites etc. The bar manager and lovely chap with the large trouser braces were the best barman ever. thanks for the Old Fashioned and Bullet gentlemen, we will come back soon and a huge part of this is due to your excellent service.

Definitely not to the standards of a 5 star hotel.Too expensive. 220 euros per night without breakfast in a classic room - doesn't worth the price.Staff pleasant but not very efficient (had to ask three times for a simple repair in the room). Hotel facilities and room a bit worn out.Cleaning staff forgot to renew some of the accessories (small towels, hygienic plastic bags).Feels like the hotel is just trying to sell you more services all the time (spa, restaurant) without any effort to provide a genuinely nice experience and without the attention to details that could be expected from a hotel in this category.

Beautiful property inside and out. First rate staff in every aspect. Very, very clean and well appointed rooms. Terrific location, right near all the action and a metro station. Really loved this place and suggest you give it a try. Great daily breakfast and the restaurant is also worthy of you time.

Had a really lovely stay with colleagues for a work trip here and would love to come back.- Amazing friendly staff who are so welcoming and pleased to help you- Immaculately clean room and bathroom- Quiet hotel with a calm atmosphere- Firm comfy bed- Air con- Plenty of towels and toiletries- Fast free wifi- FABULOUS breakfast including juices, hot drinks, cheeses, meats, breads, cereals, hot items, yoghurts, prepared fruits and cake- Long breakfast availability from 7am-11amWhat‚Äôs not to love?!There is plenty to explore all close by and you‚Äôre in one of the most beautiful cities in the world! This hotel is fantastic value and they have clearly thought hard about the guest experience. I hope to stay again and highly recommend it for work or pleasure.

Nice staff but gets quite hot in the room and the 3 bunk beds isn‚Äôt for everyone. Toilet/showers weren‚Äôt great but okay. Free breakfast is a nice addition tho.Location is ideal as it‚Äôs pretty much close to everything and the cost isn‚Äôt too bad either.

Garden view room was a little tired but clean and comfortable, breakfast was excellent along with the waiting on staff service. Concierge services were really helpful - lots of good advice. Bar was well stocked, and Location was very good, 10-15 mins walk from the metro station.

We got a great deal on this hotel for a family of 4 (2+2) including breakfast and extra bed.. The room were quite large enough to accommodate 2 queens and also an extra bed. the location is just perfect as the Hop On Hop Off bus comes nearly for sightseeing. The concierge (who also features in the hotel promo hotel) is the highlight of the place as he is extremely helpful. The breakfast is really the best I have seen with a super wide variety and omlette counters and other hot meals!! Overall an experience to remember!!

if you like to stay away from city this is a good hotel. Good rooms and courteous staff. Dont miss the breakfast. its a huge spread and has a huge dining hall. it starts as early as 630 am and is full. poolside very nice . ideal to sit and enjoy a drink in the evening hours. not when its cold outside obviously...

We visit four seasons fairways once a year, and always travel off peak (February and October).Pros:During these times it is fairly quiet, and the food and drink in the bar/restaurant always arrives quickly. The staff are always friendly and go out of their way to help. One example is earlier this year we lost part of our juicing machine in our apartment. They provided us with a new juicer within the hour.The club area that contains the restaurant, gym, bar, snooker room, swimming pool etc is well maintained and staffed. Over the past five years they seem to have been updating their facilities. The last time we went the gym area had brand new equipment and (unfortunately) both saunas were out of action as they were being replaced.2 very well looked after snooker tables upstairs. It's also free.Free wifi.Food and drink prices seem average for the area.All apartments have either a small pool or jacuzzi.Cons:Outside pool is empty whenever we go as its usually around 10c outside, outside part isn't heated. I imagine the area would be very nice in the summer. Indoor pool temperature is also fairly cold, the jacuzzi is also colder than others I've been in.Nothing else really.Always a relaxing enjoyable stay. Recent change in management seems to have kept it to its usual high standards.

Beautifully located hotel overlooking the sea and a magnificent grotto the hotel is built on the side of the cliff, most of the rooms were below reception floor 5, you have to collect your pool towels from reception on floor 5 , the sunbed and pool area are on the ground floor 1 there is one kids pool and one adult pool and plenty of sunbeds with parasols + table tennis,Free wifi if join the Discovery program (GHA Loyalty), I joined online about 4 weeks befor the stay and already had my menbers card you receive a free newspaper every day and free wifi plus 1 bottle of water per stay ( not a day).The dinner restaurant and bar overlooks the ocean but the breakfast room was in a basementHotel is not the newest, it is well worth paying the extra for a sea view . The rooms have mini-bars, televisions (older generation) and hair dryers not very powerful, Storage space is limited  wardrobe hangers of fixed variety and located to high for short people Every day is cleaning, towels, replenishing tea, coffee and toiletries every day,The recption staff always friendly and helpful The bar drinks expensive 20% off for happy hour should be at least 50% offBreakfast was plenty of choice, but the quality of dinner was disapointing.There ars stairs down to the small beach but not right to the bottom you have to climb down the rocks the last 10ft.The town of Carvoeiro is over 1/2 mile down hill with cobbled pavements could be a proplem walking if you have mobility difficulties plenty of reasonable priced taxis are availble
We have had a wonderful stay again and will of course stay in PortoBay Liberdade again whenever we are in Lisbon.

I was on a 3 day fishing trip with a friend so chose the hotel due to its proximity to the harbour. Genuinely surprised to find a fantastic hotel upon arrival - great leisure and swimming areas - lots of space creating a true luxury feel. The rooms were equally good (although we were upgraded to a partial sea view room - actually a full sea view in my opinion) - spacious and modern - the open bathroom is a bit quirky. Food was excellent and service/music at the roof top bar equally as good. Highly recommended.

My wife and I stayed 10 days at the hotel.  We weren't sure what to expect but it exceeded all our expectations.  The premium sea view rooms are worth the extra cost.  The rooms are comfortable and the view spectacular.  I can't praise all the staff enough.  Without exception they were very friendly and provided amazing service, especially Donavon and Michelle at breakfast.  The village also has a great range of friendly restaurants so there is plenty of choice.  The hotel can set you up with whale/dolphin watching which was some of the best we've experienced.I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel and being out of Funchal the surroundings are peaceful with spectacular views.

The hotel is great for exploring the island but also for relaxing days by the pool or sea. Breakfast was generous, but could have used a little more variety. The entire staff was very accommodating and extremely nice. The two biggest points of criticism during the stay were the water temperatures of the indoor and outdoor pools, which could be a little higher. However, the most incomprehensible thing about this hotel is that the spa and the loungers directly by the pool each cost an additional ‚Ç¨30 per person. This has never happened to me at any hotel in this category and I don't think it's appropriate for the overall impression of the hotel. The justification for making a unique stay possible, as with some other reviews here, is simply not conclusive. Given the price and the hotel category, the spa area should always be included. And charging another ‚Ç¨30 for ‚Äúbetter‚Äù loungers at the pool is totally incomprehensible.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Just returned from another fantastic break at Reids Palace. The service is second to none, the location is fantastic and the drink goes down a bit too easy. Had a fantastic seaview room in the old building, the stairs kept us fit (as we didn't want to use the lifts). Now have to try and loose the 5lb I have put on, that is the only netative thing, but all my own fault, need more self control.

Everything about our stay at this wonderful hotel exceeded expectations, we had a perfect holiday there. The staff is very welcoming, polite and professional, they go out of their way to make the guests happy.The facilities are amazing: we loved the large swimming pools, the private ocean access, the beautiful gardens and the indoor spa. There is no rush for the sunbeds either, plenty of them are available any time of the day. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and most of them have sea view from the balcony.The location of the hotel is ideal: Oceanfront, within walking distance to downtown Funchal or to the Lido Promenade. There are also plenty of restaurants, shops and car rental companies around the corner.

Another wonderful two weeks at the Tivoli, the setting of this hotel superb, to wake up in the morning to such a fantastic view. The staff remembered us and such a warm welcome from room staff to all staff through this hotel.  Looking forward to next year, and seeing the refurbish of rooms(especially bathrooms). Then the Tivoli will be the no 1 hotel to go to in Carvoeiro .

Came back one week ago from a lovely holiday. Friendly staff and a very clean and tidy hotel. Situated I a ideal area not far from the strip and town but quiet if you wanted that too. Will defiantly return to this hotel one day had a lovely stay and would recommend it for a family,friends or couples holiday loads of choice :)

Lovely hotel, breakfast was great, but evening meal was the same menu for the week except for Saturday evening buffet.  Be aware of charges for the indoor pool which is 11 Euros a day per person, also charges to use table tennis and pool tables. Great location for the marina.

This is a fabulous hotel with a great location on the beach and a short stroll to the marina. I travelled with a friend on a long weekend. The moment that we stepped into the hotel, the staff welcomed us and during our stay nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was clean and rooms were contemporary with extremely comfy beds. You are given a free of water each day, and a top tip is to seek out the ice machines which are slightly concealed on various floors. The bathroom is amazing. A fabulous walk in shower, lots of mirrors and even weighing scales! Plenty of free toiletries too. The bathroom is glass, however you can keep the blind down.We planned in advance to use the spa each day, and we were aware of the charge which didn't bother us.If you have a massage, then you don't have to pay the ‚Ç¨11 to access the spa. The indoor pool is great with plenty of sun beds and at times we were the only people using it. The steam room, or hamman was lovely. Adjacent to the pool is also a walk in jacuzzi. The spa facilities were the best we have experienced. We both booked massages in advance which were great, with individual changing rooms inside the treatment rooms.The buffet breakfast in the hotel is fantastic, everything you can imagine. we loved the orange juice machine! We used the hotel bar a couple of times and had a jug of sangria which was lush.This hotel was the best that we have stayed in and we can't wait to return!

First time at here and had a fabulous relaxing 4 night stay, very welcoming staff, great facilities in easy walking distance of vilamoura and Quarteira,  lovely food from the pool bar and excellent service by the pool waiters.  Lovely surprise of wine and chocolate cake left in the room for my husband's birthday.  We will definitely be returning.

Such a lovely find!  On a stormy day in Portugal, we were greeted with warm smiles and a warm room! All details lovingly attended to at this mountain retreat!  We love the rustic restoration process!All around are cork oak, olives, oranges and lemons (we even picked a few with permission of course) üåπ.The staff were all warm, kind and helpful! Am going to butcher her name, but Madilde was soooo kind. We are vegan and she made certain to clearly communicate this to the chefs......üôèüèΩWe dined at the hotel morning and evening. The chefs were very creative and made beautiful meals for us with local veggies and even found seitan!Best vegan yogurt in the world was served for breakfast!We enjoyed lovely espresso service (pingo) too, complete with soy creamer!Thank you Fabio and all dining staff for a most lovely treat!We loved coming home to our mountain retreat!Blessings to all at Convento de S√£o Paolo!

Another enjoyable stay at this resort. Been having at least one  holiday a year at this resort since 1986 due to being owners. Seen a lot of changes some good and some not so good but I feel finally MGM are getting it right. Lovely apartment with good facilities. All staff were friendly yet professional and helpful. Only had one meal in restaurant which was a breakfast. Maybe it is a bit like a staff canteen but there was an excellent choice of food. Both hot and cold buffets with plenty of choice. We tend to self cater because we enjoy trying all the local restaurants but would definatley try the restaurant again.  The Oceon Bar for the evening entertainment can be very cold at this type of year so we used the piano bar more. Looking forward to our next holiday at  CPO.
Hotel in the center, convenient to all services, abundant breakfast and friendly and helpful staff. Perfect stay. Thank you all.Flavia

Excellent service! Big thanks to Pedro who made sure all the guests were well looked after, we felt very safe in the complex. Would definitely visit again. Great location and staff made the holiday so much more enjoyable :).

Right on the beach front with great views and a pleasant stroll into busy harbour. Stayed on 8th floor, lovely room with balcony. Super pool, no problem with sun beds as they strictly enforce unattended beds and remove towels if left too long. Amazing breakfast selection. Staff all seem friendly and helpful. Will definitely go again.

date: Guda de Bwrote a review Mar 2025
text: What a warm welcome to this lovely hotel. Friendly people, who are always there for you. The location is perfect, you are so near the old town via a nice path. There are many nice restaurants within 300 meters. The hotel is very clean, fresh towels every day and poolside free towels and also great service.Breakfast has everything you want.Tasty fresh fruit, an egg every day, boiled or fried or scrambled and tasty sandwiches.Tophotel, topligging, topservice.I will definitely be back here!

We had planned this trip for well over a year as it was not only a Family Holiday but our Wedding too !We had liaised with Lili at the hotel for well over twelve months to ensure or wedding would be a dream come true , and with the support of Lili and her fabulous team it was just that.The hotel is set in wonderful grounds with the most fabulous views of the the sea and surrounding beaches.We stayed half board and both breakfast and dinner proved to be outstanding with an excellent choice of well presented foods and good service.The pool was well kept and sun beds were always available and well positioned around the well groomed gardens.Our wedding was set amongst the palm trees which was extremely private with an amazing selection horderves and a few glasses of champagne.The family holiday was wonderful and our wedding day a dream.A big thank you to Lili and her excellent team !

I booked this hotel following the reccomendations on Trip Advispr and was not disappointed. In fact I didn't think anywhere in this price bracket could be so good but it was even better than expected!Staff - absolutely brilliant. Helpful and informative without being intrusive.Breakfast - superb. Full selection of bread, local fruits etc..Setting - wonderful secluded setting in the old town. Interesting garden with lots of wildlife (blackcaps, canaries & monarch butterflies)Pool - nice (unheated) pool. Even managed to swim in the first week of February!

Slected this hotel on the strength of the reviews on Trip Adviser and to be perfectly honest lives up to most of the reviews say.Hotel is very clean, well situated and the staff are wonderfull you get a guided tour of the hotel on arrival and welcome drink, Mr Dias and his son are always about and are never to busy to talk to the guests, the pool while not heated was quite pleasant once you were in it and their was always plenty of sun loungers available.Snacks are available at the pool bar until 3pm, while i found the choice and quality of the breakfast first class.All in all one of if not the most enjoyable hotel experiences i ahve ever had and i would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Funchal.I enjoyed Funchal, me and my partner wanted a quiet holiday and certainly got it!Madiera is a lovely place with lots of things to see and do as well as very nice people if i was ever to go back i would certainly stay at this hotel again however i think that might be in few years time when we are bit older!

Returned home Monday 14/12/2015 after spending a wonderful week at this little gem of an hotel situated in a great location in the old town of Funchal. Mr Dias, family and staff are very helpful and could not do enough for you without being intrusive.The fresh fruit available at breakfast is a must and not to be missed. The rooms and the rest of the hotel are spotlessly clean and would recommend anyone looking for the small andpersonal touch hotel this is the one for you. Book now you will not be disappointed.Den & Ann

The hotel is located in Sao Goncalo, at a very short distance from the center of Funchal (you can get there in 10 minutes by bus or hotel car). During our stay we had the most beautiful sunsets, in two mornings we had quiet rain and then rainbows. The room is very cosy and nicely furnished. The hotel staff (reception,  service, cleaning team, kitchen) very kind and good professionals. When we return to Madeira, we will definitely choose the Ocean Gardens hotel!
Very pleasant stay. Very varied breakfast. Large rooms with balcony. Panoramic pool and rooftop bar with fantastic views. Excellent location. Excellent choice of hygiene products. Returning safely

Stayed here 6-16 Sept with husband, and my mum and dad.  Massive rooms, very clean and well equipped (but no kettle - boil water on hob using saucepan).  Air con was available, you need to reduce the reading on the hand held remote to 20 degrees to get the room cool (it was about 30 degrees at least while we were there). No english channels on TV but not a prob for us.  Here are the positives:Good location, very quiet.  Clean spacious rooms with lovely pool area, pool bar/snacks at reasonable prices.   Walk up steep hill to road and there are about 10-15 restaurants/bars + a couple of supermarkets and an exchange facility.  The beach is about 700 metres away. Friendly staff, intercom available in room direct to reception if you need. The strip area which is more lively is about 15-20 min stroll. Few negatives for us though, namely:  there were only approx 6 parasol shades around the pool area for approx 40 sunbeds.  Three of them were non-functional too.  This was a huge problem for us as we need to lay in shade as can't take full sun.  Management told us they had masses of parasols at beginning of season but most had broken and they had not replaced them.  So we used the Ourapraia Hotel pool - turn left at top of hill, walk past supermarket and round corner and you will see wooden steps up to the pool area.  Free to get in, masses of sunshades and comfortable beds/pool bar/snacks etc.  Other negative for us was the bar closed at 11.30pm so you couldn't stroll back later than that and have a night cap before retiring to bed.  There were very few staff around to be honest most of the time we were there.  Although a good location for able bodied, it is not suitable for people with walking difficulties as there is no lift available to get you up with your cases when you arrive (or back down).  We were on top floor and my parents on 2nd so it was a job to get up the stairs with heavy cases (and my dad found the stairs quite tough going, plus walking up the steep hill when you exit the apartments).  The beach is down too so you have a hill to come up - fine if able bodied but not otherwise.  Other than that we had a lovely time!

First of all very kind staff..very good breakfast. The room was big and nice decorated. The only bad thing is that the bathroom was small! Verry clean room. Good wi-fi. Nice location..near metro station! If i ever travel to lisbon again i'll choose it!!

We took two apartments (4 adults and a child) in this hotel , nice place new and clean . Good breakfast,not so fresh ( the fruits ). there is no equipment in the apartments kitchen . there is parking in payment under the hotel. Good wifi signal.slow Service in the hotel restaurant.Bottom line nice place but it can be better.

I found this hotel in Lisbon for a 2-day stay part of our vacation for my family, while waiting for our flight back to Warsaw. I thought it was an expensive choice, but ended up to be good for what was offered (breakfast, service, AC, Internet, location for Metro).  They have an excellent welcome and service, bar on site to get some food or coffee, and the staff even printed for me my Boarding pass for my flight.  It was an amazing choice as it was located just accross the San Sebastiao Metro station (last station from Red line, from Aeroporto station), we had access to the Lisbon city very easily, and just a 30-min ride to get back to Airport.  We could easily visit many sites from the Hotel, go for walks around in the safe neiborhood, and even go for a TelePizza meal just 2 minutes away (much cheaper than regular restaurant - great with teens!) on the same street. We could go on Sunay at 10 am to the Third Baptist Church of Lisbon for a beautiful service in Portugeese - just 5 minutes away on Filipe Folque St.  We totally recommend!  At Hotel, breakfasts are delicious, and include even those Lisbon-famous \tarts\" from Belem. Internet access is excellent downstairs and in eating area
month: but was not that good from our rom on the 8th floor - but no big deal.   Great stay!"

text: Since we love modern architecture, we decided to try Altis Belem.  The property and the service are top notch.  All the rooms have a view of the water.  From their cocktails to breakfast were superb.  I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who expects great service,  good view, delicious meals, modern amenities and immaculate rooms.

I stayed in this beautiful hotel with my husband to explorer S√£o Miquel Island. It is a small boutique hotel in calming area of Lagoa. We had the ocean suite that looks out south side of the island. A comfy bed, clean room and small kitchen area to make coffees and AC worked great. It‚Äôs very zen and quiet place so you can get a good rest. The reception team( Joao, Rebecca & Sandra) were so kind and attentive and always looking out for us. The kitchen & dining team were also lovely. The breakfast was b/t 9-11am and everything on the menu were delicious. They also have the infinity pool which I only used one day but really nice. It felt so good to come back to the hotel after a long hike and just chill by the pool area. On the dry night, they put out a pit fireplace by the pool which is very romantic. Can‚Äôt wait to come go back to the A√ßore and stay here. Thank you everyone at White villas!

We spent 6 nights at the Clarion Suites and found little to complain about.  On arrival we were told that our room would not be ready until the next day, but that they had arranged a room at another hotel for us at the same price.  So we spent our first night in a different comparable hotel and on our return to Clarion Suites the next morning were were allocated a street facing, third floor, suite.This suite was excellent and much more comfortable than the hotel room we stayed at on the first night.The breakfast room is limited in capacity, so if you want to eat inside be early or be prepared to wait for a table.  We found eating outside on the patio was refreshing on a sunny morning.Overall we found the staff most helpful and courteous, and had no issues with the cleanliness and cleaning of the suite.We would definitely stay at the Clarion Suites again if and when we return to Lisbon.

We stayed at Clarion for 8 nights late April / early May and loved it. The size of the suite was more than adequate with a spacious living area, good size bedroom, kitchenette and dining area, as well as a huge bathroom. The staff was extremely helpful, especialy the lady called Fatima at the reception desk! The room was clean and, even though facing the street, very quiet. Swimming pool area was well maintained, and we enjoyed it on a couple of afternoons, in conjunction with light snacks and drinks from the hotel's bar. Although we were warned that it was not quite centrally located, it is only 20 minutes of pleasant walk from Bairro Alto, and 5 minutes from Marques Pombal Sq metro station.The only downfall we found was breakfast. Though it is meant to be served until 11 AM, if you come down at 10:30, most of the food would be gone and no replenishment made. On the other hand, if you come earlier, you'd always have to wait for either bread, or eggs, or fruit, or coffee - there just seems to be a general lack of organization in the kitchen. Thankfully, Lisbon has many interesting choices for breakfast, so this didn't bother us much. As for Clarion, we definitely recommend it.

Location is great!  Easy walk to many waterfront restaurants. Hotel is very nice and quiet.  However, the a/c did not work in our room.  We informed the front desk of this but came back to our room at bedtime, on night two, to find it was still HOT in our beautiful room.  Also the lobby and restaurant restrooms have a weird feel about them  as they are 100% dark until you step into the room.  They need some light in these areas.

This hotel is very conveniently located on Pombal square. The metro station is right opposite the hotel and the bus stop right in front of it. The hop on hop off buses and the tours leave just a minute's walk away from the hotel. The city center is a very pleasant and convenient 15-minute walk away from Fenix Lisboa. Our room on the 4th floor was spacious and comfortable, though we found the bathroom a bit small. It had a lovely view of Pombal square. The breakfast spread was good and the staff courteous and helpful.We had a very comfortable stay here and would recommend it to guests who want to stay around the city center, yet away from the hustle, bustle and the crowds.

The Azores were already beautiful. This just added icing on the cake. We arrived to the hotel and were greeted by super friendly folks at reception, joking and smiling and welcoming. The process was so quick, we were on our way to our room in no time.Our room was ridiculous. We had requested something with nice views for our special getaway. Pestana went above and beyond! There were 360 degree views from every room - of the ocean, mountains, other side of the ocean, park, gardens, etc.We spent so much time on our balcony, watching sunset and enjoying a glass of wine. The beds were so soft and comfy. Bathroom beautiful and marble (also with views!).The hotel itself is pristine. Clean, amazing views everywhere, great design. The grounds are impeccably kept, and there is a beach right nearby that you can walk / swim. It's warm, and no seaweed or anything.Also, this hotel's restaurant may be the only place on the entire island that has reliable dining service :) They don't rush you at all, but your food and check always come out in a reasonable time, which does not seem to be the case anywhere else. We always tipped.The pool is SO amazing. Warm, beautiful, deep, and right on the ocean. Could it be any more picturesque?? We are already so excited to come back. We've recommended the hotel to everyone at home. Thank you!

The residencial is located 5 minutes from Marques de Pombal metro station, just 3 stops from downtown Lisboa. It's located on the first floor of a building but you can find it easily because there's a big sign outside. The furniture is old but the rooms and bathrooms are spotlessly clean. Breakfast is simple: tea/coffee, orange juice, bread and spreads but the bread is always fresh and the juice is real orange juice. The owner is very nice and kind and is always there if you need help with a street or a suggestion for a good restaurant. We would definitely go back.

One block away from the Douro River.  Our room was clean and roomy.  Breakfast options were plenty.  Walking distance to many wine tasting.  The gondola is also a short walk away that takes you to the top of the Dom Luis bridge and the monastery.  The area is very clean and sage

Had stayed at QDM many years ago and was pleasantly surprised on how well it had been renovated. With bright, spacious and modern rooms, and at the edge of the only of two RTJ sr courses in Portugal,  it‚Äôs a must stay for golfers. Loved it and will be back with the clubs.

Amazing hotel, spacious bedroom, extra comfortable bed and luxury bathroom. The hotel presents high quality details and the staff is amazing. We also had a round on the golf course which is probably one of the best in Portugal. All around was a great experience!

The standard room was extremely spacious, clean, and comfortable. There was a small terrace facing the water, unfortunately the weather was bad!Bed was so comfortable, room quiet, slept great!Breakfast was very good.If you want a coffee pot in the room, it needs to be ordered!Would happily stay here again, if ever in Coimbra

This hotel is very cleverly designed and the interiors are playful and ultra modern.The staff are very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, we don't speak much (any) Portugese, but the staff were eager to practice their English, lucky for us.During our stay, we had asked the lady at reception for an iron and ironing board.  However, she insisted on ironing the shirts herself, which is above and beyond, so thank you to her!Our room was luxurious and peaceful with a view over the outdoor thermal bath. It was just fabulous.All in all, a little bit if luxury and well worth the three hour drive frim Porto!

Very comfortable hotel and modern decoration.  The rooms have a size above the normal and the bathroom has the best showers I have ever tried. Very nice view to the pool.The breakfast is very complete and well made.The staff were all very friendly, helpful and made us feel like old customers even though it was the first time.
